utterance.speaker: DAVE JOHNSON
utterance.content: Oh Lord, am I on the right path? If so, please, give me a sign.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Nothing worse than bad coffee.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha? Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You tell me, kiddo. The last time we were together you and Richard were, uh – – ha ha, you know, and now just a few short weeks later you and Richard are, uh – – you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s complicated.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Mmm. So were his last two divorces.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, God, Martha, we’re not getting a divorce.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, call me old-fashioned but don’t married couples live together?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, but it’s – it’s complicated and I’m working through a few things.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard told me that, right before he declared he was going to win you back. Look, as you know, my son is a lot of things, some of them good, some of them not so good. But he is someone you can always count on. That is a rare thing, kiddo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. Uh, yeah. All right. I’ll have detectives respond. Uh, Martha, I’m sorry. I – there’s a murder and I –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No. Katherine, darling.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Look, be honest with yourself. Then be honest with your husband.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Man, I thought the second kid would be cheaper, but Jenny, she wants all new stuff. You should see the baby stroller that she picked out. Seriously, I might have to get a second fulltime job.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or … you could make more money from your first job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What, like overtime?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Promotion. Sergeant’s exam is in a week. Let’s take it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A week? When are we going to have time to study?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How hard can it be? Sergeant Wilke passed and he’s like, a chromosome away from a Neanderthal.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe you’re right. Okay, I’ll call 1PP. Sign us both up.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Good morning. Allow me the pleasure of introducing you to Dave Johnson, 52, single GSW to the sternum. Killer popped him while he was praying.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What, did you guys rehearse that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, former altar boys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, probably an involuntary reflex or something.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Wound suggests he was shot between 8 and 11 last night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Kind of late for a church to be open to the public, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It wasn’t. The sisters of the parish said the place was locked at 6 but discovered this morning that the front had been jimmied.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, what? Dave and the killer broke in together.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Doubt it. Evidence shows that the killer snuck in and shot Dave from behind what was a decorative stained glass window for prayer.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: FATHER ARGUELLO
utterance.content: What is going on here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Father, did you know Dave Johnson?

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Oh, yes. He was a faithful parishioner.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you have any idea what Dave was doing in the church last night?

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Not a clue. Perhaps his wife knows. Have you spoken to Wendy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. We haven’t notified her yet. But what can you tell us about Dave? Did … did he have an enemies?

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Oh, no. He was a good man, a loving husband, and arguably one of the greatest –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Greatest what?

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Well, it’s going to come out sooner or later. Dave was one of the greatest novelists of the last fifty years.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dave Johnson? Uh … I’ve never heard of him, Father.

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: That’s because he wrote under a pseudonym.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Dad? Did you hear?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: - my pony, you can’t pet it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Your pony?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Hey. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: PJ Moffett’s dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: PJ Moffett was one of my literary heroes.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mine too. Remember, I wrote that paper about him in eighth grade.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Every author dreams about writing the great American novel, but PJ Moffett actually did it. On his first try, too. The Butcherbird’s Song.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And in twenty five years he never wrote another word. Just one book and he disappeared from public life. According to Twitter, he was murdered at Saint Mark’s on Third.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s wonderful.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, a little respect for the dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not wonderful that he was murdered, wonderful where he was murdered. Saint Mark’s? That’s in the jurisdiction of the Twelfth Precinct and I am an expert on all things PJ Moffett.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So you’re still going with the ‘win Beckett back by working homicides with her’ plan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s how I got her to fall for me the first time. That, and when I kiss her I use the bottom of my –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, when it comes to your sex life how about we stick to the After School Special version?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s fair.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay, so what’s going to be your way into the case this time?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, all I need is a – – a client.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys? Lanie called. No usable prints from the crime scene and no hits off ballistics.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, The Butcherbird’s Song is still a popular novel, right? I mean, it’s twenty five years old, but our victim should still be getting huge royalty checks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s required reading at most high schools.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then why was he living in a one bedroom apartment and working as a janitor for the past five years?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll call the publisher, have them confirm who he is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No need. We can do that for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Castle, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meet my client. This is Wendy Johnson, wife of Dave Johnson, also known as famed novelist PJ Moffett. We’re here to make a statement.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we’ll escort her to Captain Beckett’s office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your client, Castle? Please don’t tell me you ambulance-chased this woman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, that is an outrageous accusation. I, as a member of the writing community, merely went by her home to offer my condolences.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm. And I suppose you told her that you’re a PI who just happens to have connections with the NYPD.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The topic may have come up. You look gorgeous, by the way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … we should go and talk to your client.

utterance.speaker: WENDY JOHNSON
utterance.content: We’d only been married eight months. I felt like I’d known him my entire life. Probably because I grew up just … loving that book.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, about that, Mrs. Johnson. Considering your husband’s success, why was he working as a janitor?

utterance.speaker: WENDY
utterance.content: Well that was research for a new book.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A second PJ Moffett novel?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was doing research for over five years?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Moffett was legendary for total immersion in his subject. Much like me with you. Uh, did you know that before writing a single word of The Butcherbird’s Song, Moffett spent seven years as a drug addicted Eskimo?

utterance.speaker: WENDY
utterance.content: It’s true. He was extremely dedicated to his craft. Even though he owns a ranch in Wyoming? He insisted we live in Brooklyn for authenticity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did he break into Saint Mark’s last night?

utterance.speaker: WENDY
utterance.content: I can only guess it was to pray. He had been extremely troubled recently.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know about what?

utterance.speaker: WENDY
utterance.content: I think it had to be his research. When Dave left he told me he met with someone that morning and things got heated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who did he meet with?

utterance.speaker: WENDY
utterance.content: He didn’t say. Just that the man was dangerous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well what was his new book about?

utterance.speaker: WENDY
utterance.content: Um … the mafia.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Where’s Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He took his client home. Remember, he doesn’t work cases with us anymore.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So I found out where our vic was yesterday morning. According to his financials he took a cab ride to Brooklyn.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where was he dropped off?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This guy’s house. Milton Cicero. Works in sanitation. Word is he’s totally mobbed up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If our vic was doing research for his book and he asked too many questions, Milton here might've gotten suspicious and taken Dave out.

utterance.speaker: MILTON CICERO
utterance.content: Okay. He did come to my house. But I didn’t kill him. I swear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So how do you know him?

utterance.speaker: CICERO
utterance.content: I don’t. He just came over, started asking me all these questions.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: CICERO
utterance.content: Union kickbacks. He wanted to know where all the money comes from. Say, you two have any idea who he really is?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. He’s PJ Moffett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The novelist.

utterance.speaker: CICERO
utterance.content: PJ what? The what? No. That is Jimmy “Two Guns” O’Malley.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, wait, uh … the Irish mobster who ratted out his whole crew in the 80s?

utterance.speaker: CICERO
utterance.content: Bingo. He started telling me all about witness protection and how the Feds gave him a new name. Dave Johnson.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hold on. Doesn’t the mob have a contract out on Jimmy “Two Guns’” life?

utterance.speaker: CICERO
utterance.content: Do they? I wouldn’t know anything about that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Milton? Did you try to collect on that reward? Don’t tell me that you made a call up to the mob in Boston.

utterance.speaker: CICERO
utterance.content: I didn’t … not call them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Bye bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I just got off the phone with PJ Moffett’s publisher. Our author is still very much alive. Dave Johnson was lying about who he was.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, we figured. So, Dave tells Milton that he’s Jimmy “Two Guns” O’Malley and then Milton rats him out to the Irish mob.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe our vic was a conman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And conning the wrong guy got him killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Captain Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. You heard back from the FBI?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s looking more and more like the Irish mob are responsible for Dave’s murder. Meet Billy O’Rourke. A suspected hit man from Southie. Word on the street is he landed at JFK yesterday afternoon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is he still in town?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, as of two minutes ago he hadn’t checked out of the Biltmore Hotel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Go find Espo and pick him up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Be careful.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is he in there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. Thanks. Get out of here, kid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, she’s telling me she needs space. I’m saying, that’s a cry for help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, guys. How are you – are you hungry?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On your feet. Right now, O’Rourke.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle, how’d you get here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, when I gave Dave’s wife a ride home I saw a receipt from yesterday. A rush dry cleaning job on Dave’s jacket? The bill was charged to this room. How’d you get here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The FBI.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, this guy? He’s a hitman for the Irish mob.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Well, yes. Yes. But when you get to know him he’s actually really a lovely person, you know? He’s a good listener.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you for that. Very hospitable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And he actually told me that Dave –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, but they’re my cops, though. These guys are okay. Just – guys, Billy’s not your killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh? You know this how?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Billy told me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ohhh … yeah. Oh, did he also cross his heart and hope to die?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Billy, tell them what you told me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hypothetically.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know where that is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right? So Dave explains, it’s all just a misunderstanding. That he’s actually PJ Moffett –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - and he’s telling everybody he’s Jimmy “Two Guns” so he can do research for his new novel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, please. I have a copy myself.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey, hey!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. So Billy brings Dave back here and he pays to have his jacket cleaned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huh!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, isn’t that lovely?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, hate to burst your bubble, though. He ended up not being PJ Moffett after all. Guy was a conman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And by the way, Castle, no matter what you say here? It doesn’t prove that your new BFF Billy didn’t off Dave.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it doesn’t. But his alibi does.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At the time of the murder he was front row at The Lion King.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, well, you’re not wrong. But tell them what you saw before you put Dave in the trunk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hypothetically.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Admit it, he’s not so bad of a guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, just because his alibi held and he paid for lunch doesn’t make him a great humanitarian. He kills people for a living.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but without people like him, people like us would be out of a job. Now, what’s our next move? Locate and identify this mystery man?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. That’s our next move.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Your next move is to go home. Beckett doesn’t want you working the case. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Um … I get it. Totally understand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll circle back around, uh … update my client.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s – yeah, that’s too much.

utterance.speaker: CARL
utterance.content: Oh Captain, my Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Carl. Hey. Thank you for coming up from CSU. I need you to give me a rundown of narcotic signatures. Specifically heroin.

utterance.speaker: CARL
utterance.content: Basically every batch of heroin is like a snowflake; no two are alike. To determine if samples are from the same batch we run a chromatographic impurity signature profile analysis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s say I have a sample of heroin and I compare it to another sample and that’ll help me determine if they originated from the same source?

utterance.speaker: CARL
utterance.content: Exactamundo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. That’s all I needed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What up, Carl?

utterance.speaker: CARL
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, what are you meeting with CSU’s narcotics guy for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, Espo, I do have other cases that I have to supervise.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: My apologies, Capitán.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So any luck on finding that mystery man?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan’s scrubbing street cam footage near Dave’s apartment, but yo … I think we’re missing something here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, if Dave was a scam artist he’s the oddest one I ever heard of. I mean, yes, he was exhibiting conman behavior, but to what end?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … to rip people off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who? His wife? She didn’t come from money. The priest took a vow of poverty and the union guy? Dave never asked him for a payoff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, that’s a good point. So what’s the upside to Dave’s cons?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So I ID’ed our mystery man who threatened Dave. Guy’s name is Eric Logan. He’s a convicted scam artist. Two collars for assault, including one with a deadly weapon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, maybe Eric and Dave were working a con together and something went wrong. Any idea where Eric is now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I pinged his cell. Got a location.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s go pick him up.

utterance.speaker: UNIFORM
utterance.content: Evidence room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, this is Captain Beckett. Do we still have the seized heroin from the Vulcan Simmons case?

utterance.speaker: UNIFORM
utterance.content: Hang on, let me check.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll hold.

utterance.speaker: UNIFORM
utterance.content: Yes, we do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. That’s all I needed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, thanks for trying. Hey, bad news. There’s no more slots open for the sergeant’s exam.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Damn. Well, I guess we going to have to wait until the next slot opens up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bogies, three o’clock.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa! Geez!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. I was just going to that … uh … just going to that bodega there. Pick something up. A little Slim Jim. You?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, how did you know that we were here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you put this tracker on me when you gave me that awkward hug?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have no idea what that is. But I’ll take it off your hands.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, sure. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know I can find that, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys, it’s Eric.

utterance.speaker: BOB
utterance.content: But I never really had a fair shot in life, you know? Uh … my parents, they died in a plane crash when I was a kid. That’s a lie. Actually, my parents live in Denver. Cleveland. Anyway, uh … my name’s Steve, thanks for listening.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Thanks, Bob. Before we close, friends, today is a sad day. Because we just lost one of our own. Dave Johnson … his is a cautionary tale. Because last night Dave’s lies finally caught up with him. Let’s take a moment for Dave.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What is this, an AA meeting?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: PLA.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell’s PLA?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pathological Liars Anonymous. Makes perfect sense. Dave wasn’t a conman. He was a pathological liar.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. I didn’t kill Dave. He was my friend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You sure about that? Because the day he was killed a witness saw you threatening him.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: I was his sponsor. He was in trouble. I was pushing him to attend a Pathological Liars Anonymous meeting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: "Yeah, that’s the ticket. That’s it. Very nice."

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: How dare you, sir. Compulsive and pathological lying is a mental disorder caused by psychological trauma. This is not something to joke around about.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay. Fine. But then how can we believe anything you say about Dave? You’re a self-confessed liar.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: I’m reformed. I took a vow of honesty. A pledge. To refrain from lying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everybody lies.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Not me. Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not even a little fib?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A white lie?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: No. I can prove it to you. Ask me what I think about your writing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you think of my writing?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: I think you’re a Patterson wannabe and I think your last book was a boring retread.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: You see? Brutal truth.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, no. That’s just being mean.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: No. Honest. Unlike you, a man who obviously wears lifts so he can lie about his height.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no. These aren’t lifts. These are custom, prescription insoles.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Uh huh. What are you laughing about? You clearly dye your hair so you can lie about your age.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just a little bit … in the temples.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, look, look. Let’s assume what you’re saying – – is true. You said Dave was in trouble. What kind of trouble?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: It started a couple weeks ago. He fell off the wagon. He started lying out of control. He was scared.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Scared of what?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: He had uncovered something, something dangerous. Illegal.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why didn’t he come to the cops?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Oh, he’s lied so many times to so many people. Even his own wife. He knew nobody would believe him. He was the boy who cried wolf. But whatever it was he said he needed proof before he could go public.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go public with what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He didn’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you think that the sponsor’s telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: As far as we could tell. Plus, his alibi is rock solid for the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve got to figure out what Dave was on to two weeks ago that got him killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Already on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great job, guys. I’ll see you in the morning?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A text from Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, me too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: “My place. Important.”

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: “My place. Important.”

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe he found something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do we do?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We go over to his place. We find out what’s what. Whatever we do, we don’t –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, hell no. But what if she finds out?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We lie our asses off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait. Do you hear something?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hola! Amigos! Bienvenido a casa Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice! Very nice, gentlemen, very nice!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … what is this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is just me saying thank you to my family at the Twelfth Precinct.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, you’re trying to buy our love.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So we’ll help you win Beckett back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Come on, guys. These are for you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro, you’re putting us in a really tough spot here. You know we’re friends with Beckett, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Plus Beckett’s our boss now. She doesn’t want you working cases.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys. I love her, okay? And I’m going to get her back. The only way I know how to do that is by solving murders together, so I’m not going anywhere. So sit back, relax, and enjoy the ride. And try the tostadas. They're Wagyu beef.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ooh. I do love me some Wagyu. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, nothing. Jenny just … you know, she wants me to pick up some stuff on the way home. It’s …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? Because that text message said "sergeants exam".

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, I may have lied. Earlier. There was an exam slot open. But only one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you took it? Without even talking to me? Bro, that was my idea.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I – you know how stressed out about money I’ve been lately. A bump in pay would really help. Javi. Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Save it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I couldn’t help but overhear uh … your financial concerns. Maybe you and I could work together.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well … do a little, uh, moonlighting for me. Just keep me in the loop as to what’s going on at the Twelfth.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You want me to be a rat for you? Hell no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I would pay you five hundred a week –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey partner. Food truck is here, so I got you some breakfast. Double salsa, just the way you like it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, hey. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh … I was just treating that burrito the way you treated me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, I lied to you. I’m – I’m sorry. I have responsibilities.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I guess looking out for your partner’s back isn’t one of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fine. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need you to go down to city hall. Dave’s boss said that Dave had an incident there two weeks ago and his janitorial company was forced to reassign him to a different facility.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What kind of incident?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think that’s what she’s sending us down there to find out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What have you got for me?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, apparently our vic had some sort of confrontation down at city hall so we’re running down there to talk to the deputy’s chief of staff. Okay, I love you too, sweetie. Bye bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was weird.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ryan just told me he loved me. I’m sure he was just … covering.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Don’t you feel the least bit conflicted about turning him into a mole?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s not stealing state secrets. I’m just paying him to keep me in the loop on their cases.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So you can ingratiate yourself in said cases and find new ways to interact with Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if by ingratiate myself you mean dazzle her with my Sherlockian genius, then yes, that’s exactly what I mean.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So what did Ryan say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That our victim got himself into some trouble at city hall that might have got him killed. So what do you say – – we call my good buddy … the Mayor.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dave was a janitor, Dad. I sincerely doubt he was on the Mayor’s radar.

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN REED
utterance.content: We fired Dave Johnson after he broke into the accounting office. And he tried to run when security caught him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, what did he say when they caught him.

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: Oh, some nonsense about being on a mission from God … or something … which was incredibly disrespectful, given how he got the job in the first place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And how’s that?

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: Well, he was recommended by Father Arguello at Saint Mark's.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The blind priest?

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dave was killed in Arguello’s church.

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: Oh, um … look, I’m no detective, but that sounds like a clue. Uh, if you’ll excuse me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Looks like we need to talk to the good Father. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, wait. Just a second. Um … … I’ll make a quick phone call to Jenny. I’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A mission from God?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s what Ryan said. On the other hand, Dave was a compulsive liar.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hmm. Still, most lies have a kernel of truth in them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, like when you went to Fashion Week but you neglected to mention that you were taking my platinum credit card?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I was more thinking about our victim and how he lied about being a fugitive mobster in order to investigate union kickbacks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kickbacks that could be connected to City Hall and Dave breaking into the accounting office.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But what does any of this have to do with a blind priest?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, ask and you shall receive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … excuse me, Father. We are investigating Dave Johnson’s murder and would like to ask you a few questions regarding your relationship with him.

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: I was his priest, my son. I gave him spiritual guidance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And which part of that guidance included breaking and entering at City Hall?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The blind priest just ran away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This cannot end well.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Should we - ?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Damn it. Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So let me get this straight. You got parkoured by a blind priest?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d say the blindness is under dispute.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh. And what about the fact that he’s sixty? Was he faking his age, too?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sixty is the new twenty. Did you call just to bust my chops?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … pretty much. Um … all right, speedy, I gotta go. Make sure you stretch before bed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They got the priest.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett was having too much fun. Wait. Beckett was having fun. With me. Score.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Imagine how much fun she’s going to have with the runaway priest.

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Can I be honest with you? I went blind to get out of Tampa. It was miserable down there.

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: The humidity was just … oppressive. When I learned that priests with certain disabilities have their pick of assignments, I – I didn’t even hesitate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t understand what any of this has to do with Dave Johnson’s murder.

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Dave’s lie was a terrible burden. One that he’d been carrying since childhood. I offered him a way to make amends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And this is you still being honest?

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Yes. Dave’s lying torpedoed his accounting career. That’s why he was working as a janitor at City Hall pretending to be a reclusive author. My parish was about to miss a payment to the city due to my … mismanagement of funds. I simply asked Dave to sneak into the accounting office and log the payment into the computer as received.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so this wasn’t about making amends. This was about helping you.

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: When Dave was hacked into the city budget he found evidence of a secret slush fund. Ten million dollars siphoned from social programs to line someone’s pocket. It was a lie Dave couldn’t stomach. So he vowed to expose it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you believe whoever controlled this alleged slush fund discovered Dave’s intrusion?

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: They killed him for it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what do you think?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It tracks with what our victim told his sponsor.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And with Dave’s questions about union kickbacks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter. It’s not actionable. There’s no way we’re going to get a subpoena for City Hall based on hearsay told to a not-blind priest from a pathological liar.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I guess Dave was right. No one believes the boy who cries wolf.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what are you saying? We give up? Because that’s not the Beckett that I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I’m saying that we should give up. What I’m saying is that I’ve been a captain for about five minutes. If we take this to the DA nobody’s going to take me seriously. Ever.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. We’ll get proof.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Money’s gone. Even if there is a secret slush fund the person controlling it killed Dave to cover it up. Buried the money deep. Covered his tracks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what are we supposed to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We do our homework. We find out who could pull off a slush fund in the city budget. Which means we need to talk to someone with contacts and resources in City Hall.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Someone … who’s best friends with the mayor? Someone like Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s going to be so smug about this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, did you say you needed my help?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You heard her say it, right?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, let it go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. Castle, do you have the intel we need or not?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell her.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: When I was in middle school Dad did four months of extensive research into the inner workings of city finance for a novel he was writing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but then I realized that that novel would be the most boring novel in the history of novels, so I wrote a Derrick Storm book instead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, so then you have a pretty good idea of which city officials would be able to hide a 10 million dollar slush fund.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, and it’s a pretty small list. The only people with access to the entire budget are the comptroller, the Mayor’s chief of staff, and the deputy chief.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Stephen Reed, the guy we met with?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know for a fact that the chief of staff is in London with the Mayor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And I made a few discreet calls. The city comptroller was at a fundraiser when Dave was shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means Reed is our main suspect.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, so how do we get this guy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: May I suggest the Midnight Run strategy?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Midnight Run. It’s one of the top five buddy movies of all time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And you’re suggesting we base our legal strategy upon this buddy-cop movie?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, he’s right. It could work. At the end of the movie Robert DeNiro tricks a mobster into taking computer discs he thinks contain evidence against him. And just by showing up to take them the mobster is committing conspiracy to obstruct justice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If we can trick Reed the same way then we’ve got all the leverage we need to expose the slush fund and go after him for Dave’s murder. But Kate … you can’t be involved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because if Reed isn’t involved and all this blows up in our face then you take the hit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You don’t need that. Let us shield you, Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’m out. For now. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, how do we do this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: First? I’m going to need to borrow your blind priest.

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Mr. Reed? Mr. Reed?

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: Oh, Father. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Uh – your office told me where to find you.

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: Ah, well, sorry Father. Appointment only, even for the clergy.

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: I don’t think you want your office to hear what we’re about to discuss. Dave Johnson was one of my flock.

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: Who got fired for being where he didn’t belong.

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Yes, but while he was there Dave told me he stumbled across your little secret account.

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: Ah … I’ve got no idea what you’re taking about. And uh … my hot dog’s waiting, so –

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Dave was a cautious man, Mr. Reed. He took proof of the account. Proof that he left on a thumb drive on the altar of my church behind the chalice before he was killed. I give you this information as a gift. If you were to make the church’s debt disappear, as a token of appreciation, well, the Lord would be grateful.

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: Like I said, Father, I’ve got no clue what you’re taking about. Don’t ever come see me again.

utterance.speaker: ARGUELLO
utterance.content: Bless you, my child.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Think it worked?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course it worked.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll know tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That it worked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right … you know what to do.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Are you sure about this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go big or go home. Except – in this case. Home might be jail.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is that him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s gotta be him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t move!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stop! Police!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s gone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Damn it! Where’d he go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re screwed. Catching him with that empty thumb drive was our whole conspiracy charge.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did it work?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did what work?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you the one that turned the lights out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I told her to do that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why in the hell would you do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I thought our Midnight Run strategy needed a little twist. Trust me, guys, if this works we’re going to have him on a whole lot more than just obstruction.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What if it doesn’t?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi. I’m Richard Castle, Private Investigator. The moment you plugged this thumb drive into your computer it injected a virus into your system. By now that virus has searched your keystroke history and found where you’ve moved your hidden slush fund. It’s the computer equivalent of an exploding dye pack. Oops.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I guess we can add destruction of city property to those charges.

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: I didn’t kill him. Why would I? He was a liar. Plus, I have an alibi.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let me guess. You were home. Alone. Asleep.

utterance.speaker: STEPHEN
utterance.content: Nope. I was out playing poker. With your boss, the police commissioner. Which means your killer’s still out there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do we know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dave Johnson. He was a pathological liar who stumbled upon a secret slush fund and then decided to expose it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And everyone connected to that alibied out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we’ve got nothing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. We can safely assume Dave was killed over a lie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which lie, then?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if I was writing this I would fall back on a theme. A lie is a betrayal of trust.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And there’s no greater betrayal than a lie in a marriage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, that might be, but Wendy thought that Dave was PJ Moffett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if she found out he wasn’t?

utterance.speaker: WENDY
utterance.content: You have this all wrong. I didn’t kill Dave.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found fragments of stained glass in your car. It matches the broken glass found in the church.

utterance.speaker: WENDY
utterance.content: I only married Dave because he told me he was a famous author. I just – I thought I was going to be living in luxury. And – and he insisted we live in poverty, even though he had millions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only, he was lying. And you found out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, what I don’t understand is why would you kill him? Why didn’t you just divorce the guy?

utterance.speaker: WENDY
utterance.content: Because he had to pay. For what he cost me. I could have married Ben Schapiro, the carpet king of Nassau county. But instead I married a liar who ruined my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wendy Johnson, you are under arrest for the murder of your husband.

utterance.speaker: WENDY
utterance.content: Wait. Wait!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. In a few days you’re going to receive an invoice. I’d appreciate prompt payment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, hey. Stop, stop, stop. Listen. I’m going to call 1PP and I’m going to ask them to give you that last sergeant’s exam slot instead of me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITIO
utterance.content: I don’t need your charity.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s not charity.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Hey, I did wrong by you. I’m trying to make amends here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, bozos. Did it ever occur to you that your captain could pull some strings and get you both a slot?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
